intro: Siphisia thwaitesii, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Siphisia thwaitesii typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
